definition: an official position/a job in the bureaucracy

sentences.english: Border areas there were numerous vacancies in the lower-level official, the situation required post agenting.
sentences.chinese: 邊地存在不少官職空缺，需要職務代理的情況。

sentences.english: Then he quitted the official position and restarted a fisherman's family life.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他辭去了官職，重新過起捕魚爲生的漁家生活。

sentences.english: Later, he was reinstated so many people remembered him again and wanted to visit him.
sentences.chinese: 再到後來，翟公恢復了官職，很多人又想來他家拜訪。

sentences.english: The king must appoint me a position, ordering me to take charge of some state affairs.
sentences.chinese: 齊王他必會授我官職，要求我負責一些國家的事務。

sentences.english: He shoulders the responsibility of high political office.
sentences.chinese: 他在擔負着高級官職的責任。

sentences.english: Besides, stamps for sealing documents and letters were inscribed with social positions and official ranks to vouch for the veracity of orders.
sentences.chinese: 印章刻有地位和官職，用於文件和書信，以爲憑信。

sentences.english: I'd have the power to appoint people to positions of importance.
sentences.chinese: 我將擁有任命重要官職的權利。

sentences.english: Whenever a man has cast a longing eye on them (offices), a rottenness begins in his conduct.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有人覬覦官職，此人品行則已開始墮落。

sentences.english: Bingsheng Guan is a special type of official in Beiqi.
sentences.chinese: 並省官是北齊一種比較獨特的官職。

sentences.english: Qixinlang, the official position, wasn' t abolished until Kangxi Period.
sentences.chinese: 至康熙時期，啓心郎這一官職被廢止。

sentences.english: The president would no doubt then reward former warlords who supported him with jobs and spoils.
sentences.chinese: 無疑卡爾扎伊之後會以部分官職回饋軍閥對他的支持。

sentences.english: There are phenomena of translation mismatches of ancient Chinese official titles in Chinese classical literature translation.
sentences.chinese: 我國古代官職名稱的翻譯可以採用對應法和解釋法。

sentences.english: The general decided to promote him and award him with medals of bravery and honor.
sentences.chinese: 將軍決定提升他的官職並授予他英雄榮譽勳章。

sentences.english: YangGuang when the emperor after, to appointed under each new office.
sentences.chinese: 楊廣當上皇帝之後，重新任命各個手下新官職。
而是在官職和榮譽稱號上。

definition: noble and lowly/high versus low social hierarchy of ruler to people, father to son, husband to wife in Confucianism
strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
county magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
